citation.article-title: Description of Caldanaerobius fijiensis gen. nov., sp. nov., an inulin-degrading, ethanol-producing, thermophilic bacterium from a Fijian hot spring sediment, and reclassification of Thermoanaerobacterium polysaccharolyticum and Thermoanaerobacterium zeae as Caldanaerobius polysaccharolyticus comb. nov. and Caldanaerobius zeae comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Caldanaerobius zeae comb. nov.
Caldanaerobius zeae [zeâ€²ae. N.L. gen. n. zeae of Zea mays (maize or corn), describing the use of corn as a substrate].
Basonym: Thermoanaerobacterium zeae Cann et al. 2001.
The description is the same as that given for Thermoanaerobacterium zeae by Cann et al. (2001).
The type strain is mel2T (=ATCC BAA-16T =DSM 13642T).
